We salute and honor Captain Linda Garcia Cubero for her remarkable service and leadership! #HispanicHeritageMonth http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FAZN3axUUAA0xt5.jpg

Captain Cubero continues to mentor Hispanic and Latino American Air Force cadets. She also remains steadfast in her commitment to community service. For her outstanding contributions to her community, she was awarded the 1991 Hispanic Engineer National Achievement Pioneer Award.

After graduating, Captain Cubero served for seven years in @usairforce as a command briefer and worked on national-level task forces at the Pentagon. For her work with the intelligence task force on the Falkland Islands conflict, she earned the Joint Service Commendation Medal.

In 1980, Cubero made history when she became the first Hispanic woman to graduate from any service academy. She earned her degree in Political Science and her free-fall parachute wings. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FAZNDFaVUAMICn9.jpg

Influenced by her father‚Äôs notable service in the United States Air Force, Captain Cubero attended the United States Air Force Academy in 1976. She was among the charter class of 157 women that entered the Air Force Academy that year. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FAZNAFzVkAItm58.jpg

Next in our #WomenVetsTaskForce series celebrating Latina and Hispanic American women veterans during #HispanicHeritageMonth, we are highlighting the significant contributions of Captain Linda Garcia Cubero. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FAZM6NkVEAMAuN3.jpg

In today's increasingly industrialized world, we must work to preserve important cultural & environmental sites like the Great Dismal Swamp. Today's passage of my legislation is an important step in preserving the vital resources, wildlife, & historical importance of the region.
